turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Act (band).
turn.1: What happened in 1986 with The Act?
turn.2: Berlin had played with the LA-bands The Plugz and The Blasters and arrived in Oslo fresh from sessions with his new band Los Lobos for the milestone Paul Simon album "Graceland" (not released until August 1986).
turn.4: It soon became obvious that the sessions could not be timed around Bøgeberg's other commitments, so about half of the drum tracks were laid down by top session player Per Hillestad (Lava, a-ha etc.)
turn.5: What happened with the other half?
turn.6: In tune with Berlin's ambitions for a professional "state-of-the-art" album, session players were also brought in for some guitar parts and only one song by Rune Krogseth ended up on the album.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: All in all the more upbeat and snappy side of the band - one writer had labelled them "pop 'n' roll" - was toned down in favour of their moodier, more dramatic side.
turn.12: 1985, The Act played in front of tens of thousands at Rock On The Dock, the Norwegian version of Band Aid which was held outdoors in the port of Oslo.
